instruction:

input:
## Buggy Code:

instruction:
You are a Rust expert. Fix the following code that has a compilation error.
Return ONLY the fixed Rust code without any explanation or markdown formatting.
input:
## Buggy Code:
```rust
use std::collections::HashMap; fn lookup(map: &HashMap<String, i32>, id: &str) -> Result<i32, &str> { map.get(id).copied() }
```

## Compiler Error:
expected `Result<i32, &str>`, found `Option<i32>`

## Fixed Code:
output: use std::collections::HashMap; fn lookup(map: &HashMap<String, i32>, id: &str) -> Result<i32, &str> { map.get(id).copied().ok_or("not found") }

instruction:
You are a Rust expert. Fix the following code that has a compilation error.
Return ONLY the fixed Rust code without any explanation or markdown formatting.
input:
## Buggy Code:
```rust
fn find_even(items: &[i32]) -> Result<i32, &str> { items.iter().find(|x| *x % 2 == 0).copied() }
```

## Compiler Error:
expected `Result<i32, &str>`, found `Option<i32>`

## Fixed Code:
output: fn find_even(items: &[i32]) -> Result<i32, &str> { items.iter().find(|x| *x % 2 == 0).copied().ok_or("no even number") }
